Description: Prosecution Marple Polymer Processors Ltd after a worker’s arm was trapped in machinery. An employee of Marple Polymers Processors Limited was cleaning a stationary conveyor belt on a Banbury mixing machine.  Unaware cleaning was taking place, another employee started the conveyor belt system resulting in the other employees left arm being trapped between the conveyor belt and the tension idler causing serious injuries to their arm and hand. HSE investigation found the company’s system of work was unsafe as it relied too heavily on effective communication between employees who were working on the machine in a dark and noisy environment.
